The Maldives has more developed tourism infrastructure, while Lakshadweep faces restrictions due to environmental concerns and limited land area.
Lakshadweep has fewer tourist accommodations compared to the Maldives, partly due to its smaller land area. The Maldives offers a larger number of hotel rooms and resorts compared to Lakshadweep.

Reaching Lakshadweep is challenging due to limited transport options. There is only one flight per day from Kochi to Agatti and daily passenger ships from Kochi. Options like cruise liners exist but are less convenient.   The Maldives has better connectivity with 18 airports, including five international ones, while Lakshadweep has very limited transport options.

1. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
2. The Most Merciful.
3. He taught the Quran.
4. He created man.
5. He taught him eloquence.
6. The sun and the moon move with precision.
7. The stars and the trees prostrate.
8. He raised the sky and set the balance.
9. Do not transgress in the balance.
10. Establish weight with justice, and do not give less in the balance.
11. He placed the earth for all creatures.
12. In it are fruits and date-palms with sheaths.
13. And grains with husks and aromatic plants.
14. So, which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
15. He created man from clay like pottery.
16. And He created the jinn from smokeless flame.
17. So, which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
18. The Lord of the two Easts and the Lord of the two Wests.
19. So, which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
20. He released the two seas, meeting side by side.
21. Between them is a barrier, neither of them transgresses.
22. So, which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
23. Out of both come pearl and coral.
24. So, which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
25. His are the ships with elevated sails in the sea like mountains.
26. So, which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?
27. Everyone upon the earth will perish.

Let's try to find some similar teachings and concepts between Quran and Texts that are followed by Hindus.

Concept of God
Verse 1: тАЬHe is God the one and onlyтАЭ. 
Compare it with:
 "He is One only without a secondтАЭ. (Chandogya Upanishad chapter 6, section 2, verse 1)

God
Verse 2: тАЬGod is absolute and eternal.тАЭ 
Compare with:
 тАЬThe supreme Lord of all the worlds.тАЭ (Bhagvad Gita chapter 10, verse 3)

He
Verse 3: тАЬHe begets not, nor is He begotten.тАЭ Compare with:
 тАЬOf Him there are neither parents nor lordтАЭ (Svetasvatara Upanishad chapter 6, verse 9).

Him
Verse 4: тАЬAnd there is none like unto Him.тАЭ Compare with:
 "There is no likeness of Him" (Svetasvatara Upanishad chapter 4, verse 19)

Concept of Heaven
In Veda: тАЬMay all these streams of butter, with their banks of honey, flowing with distilled water, and milk and curds and water reach thee in domestic life enhancing thy pleasure. May thou acquire completely these things strengthening the soul in diverse ways.тАЭ (Atharva Veda Book 4 hymn 34 verse 6). 
In Quran:
 тАЬHe will forgive you your sins and admit you to Gardens beneath which rivers flow and to beautiful mansions in Gardens of Eternity: that is indeed the supreme AchievementтАЭ (Quran S. Saff, 61:12). тАЬ(Here is) a Parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised: in it are rivers of water incorruptible: rivers of milk of which the taste never changes; rivers of wine a joy to those who drink; and rivers of honey pure and clear. In it there are for them all kinds of fruits and Grace from their LordтАЭ (Quran S. Mohammad, 47:15)

Concept of Hell
In Veda: тАЬMay the bounteous fire divine, consume them with his fiercely glowing sharp jaws like flames, who disregard the commandments and steadfast laws of most venerable and sagacious Lord.тАЭ (Rigveda 4:5:4). 

In Quran:
 тАЬ(It is) the Fire of (the Wrath of) Allah kindled (to a blaze) The which doth mount (Right) to the Hearts: It shall be made into a vault over them. In columns outstretched.тАЭ (Quran S. Humaza 104:6-9). тАЬThose who reject Our Signs We shall soon cast into the fire: as often as their skins are roasted through We shall change them for fresh skins that they may taste the penalty: (Quran S. Nisa, 4: 56). тАЬDeath will come to him from every quarter yet will he not die: and in front of him will be a chastisement unrelentingтАЭ (Quran S Ibrahim, 14:17).


Concept of charity
Zakat or Poor due in Islam: Every Muslim is obliged to pay 2.5 % of his savings to his less fortunate fellow human beings every lunar year. This is a тАШpurification-of-wealth taxтАЩ Here the wealth revolves from rich to the poor. 
Charity in Hinduism: Charity is also prescribed in Hinduism. тАЬIf it is expected of every rich man to satisfy the poor implorer; let the rich person have a distant vision (for a rich of today may not remain rich tomorrow). Remember that riches revolve from one man to another, as revolve the wheels of a chariot.тАЭ (Rigveda Bk. 10 hymn 117 verse 5)

Life after death
Bhagvat Gita (2:22) says: тАЬAs a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, the soul similarly accepts new material bodies, giving up the old and useless.тАЭ The Quran says: 1. тАЬHow can ye reject the faith in Allah? Seeing that ye were without life, and He gave you life; then will He cause you to die, and will He again bring you to life; and again to Him will ye return.тАЭ (QurтАЩan S. Baqara, 2:28). 2. This Life is a test for the hereafter: тАЬHe Who created death and life, that He may try which of you is best in deedтАЭ (QurтАЩan S. Mulk, 67:2). 3. Full Recompense on the Day of Judgment: тАЬAnd only on the Day of Judgment shall you be paid your full recompense.тАЭ (QurтАЩan S. Imran, 3:185).

God the Greatest
тАЬAllahu AkbarтАЭ God is the greatest. 
"Dev maha osi" "God is verily great" (Atharvaveda Book 20, hymn 58 and verse 3:).

God is Great
тАЬPraise be to Allah The Cherisher and Sustainer of the Worlds.тАЭ (Quran S. Fateha, 1:2). 
тАЬVerily, Great is the Glory of the Divine Creator.тАЭ (Rigved 5:81:1)

Most Gracious
тАЬMost Gracious, Most MercifulтАЭ (Quran S. Fateha, 1:3)
 тАЬThe Bounteous Giver.тАЭ (Rigved 3:34:1)

The Leader
тАЬShow us the straight way, The way of those on whom Thou hast bestowed Thy Grace, those whose (Portion) Is not wrath, and who go not astray.тАЭ (Quran S. Fateha, 1:6-7) 
тАЬLead us to the good path and remove the sin that makes us stray and wander.тАЭ (Yajurved 40:16).

The One
тАЬSeest thou one Who denies the Judgement (To come)? Then such is the (man) Who repulses the orphan (With harshness). And encourages not The feeding of the indigent.тАЭ (Quran S. Maun, 107:1-3) 
тАЬThe man with food in store who, when the needy comes in miserable ease begging for bread to eat, hardens his heart against him even when of old did him service тАУ finds not one to comfort him.тАЭ (Rigved 10:117:2).

тАШShashtangтАЩ and тАШSejdahтАЩ
One of the best type of Prayer in Hinduism is тАШShashtangтАЩ. The word тАШshashtangтАЩ is made up of тАШSaтАЩ and тАШAshtтАЩ which means eight and тАШAngтАЩ which means тАШparts of the bodyтАЩ. Thus, shastang is a mode of worship when eight parts of the body, namely, forehead, nose, two hands, two knees, and two feet, touch the ground. The best way a person can do this is like Muslims who prostrate in their тАШSejdahтАЩ during prayer touching their forehead, nose, two hands, two knees, and two feet to the ground.

As a Maldivian myself, I can say he is telling the truth. I personally have always felt Indians as  family, due to years of friendship and many of us are quite comfortable around Indians that are teachers , doctors in our country and I have lots of childhood memories and respect for our Indian teachers.  This isn't about Indians, or Maldivians.  It's dirty politics that is dividing the population. Despite, the conduct of the 3 ministers was still disappointing for many Maldivians, Yet it doesn't describe the opinion of entire population. As a millennium, I grew up listening the stories of how Indians helped us in many difficult situations, specially when we got attacked, that act of kindness by Indians won my heart and always be grateful for being our helpline so far and many Maldivians still loves the vibe of India Maldives than China, for me I do not have personal issues with China but i feel a sense of trust and sense of family towards Indians. Our way of thinking, our sentiments and even in our language there are lot in common, and due to this reason majority of Maldivians understand Hindi language. Also we love to watch Indian movies and Indian food, etc.. I have always been neutral about politics and have stayed away from it but this issue has concerned me lot... I hope this  doesnt ruin the years of friendship between two countries.. let's hope for the best..
